Hi all. Having some issues with the new programmable email templates. According to this info (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/email/hubdb-crm-objects>) I should be able to query HubDB using contact properties. What Iâ€™m trying to do is render some HTML that is stored in HubDB. The tutorial I linked to says that I should be able to pull data from HubDB into a drag and drop template, _or_ a coded email template. However, while the former works, it does not render the HTML, and instead treats it as a string. Using the latter, I am unable to get any data at all from HubDB.

Can anyone help with this please?

This issue is becoming really weird.

If I use this code, the HTML tags are escaped when the email renders, resulting in the code being displayed as plain text:
```{% set template = hubdb_table_rows(1234567, "email_name=welcome&site_domain="~contact.site_domain) %}

{{ template[0].html }} ```

However, when I specify the full query without using any contact properties, the HTML is not escaped and is rendered directly within the email template as expected:
```{% set template = hubdb_table_rows(1234567, "email_name=welcome&site_domain=<https://www.sitename.com>") %}

{{ template[0].html }} ```
I see no reason why we should expect this to render the output differently depending on how the query is structured.

This has to be a bug, right?
